p: Whenever a new pathogen appears, its origin always causes widespread concern. Most of the emerging infectious diseases that affect humans are zoonotic, which can be traced back to some specific wildlife, but there have been few analytical tools to determine which host species may carry the next virus that will infect humans, or which viruses may cross species boundaries directly.
